Preview: Rooftop solar power has become something of a frontier land rush as we shift to renewable energy to fight climate change. Hundreds of entrepreneurs, some with little or no experience, have flooded into the business. The recent collapse of a Mooresville-based installer is a warning to buyers.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Few answers in Moore County more than a week after substation ...
Preview: Ten days after two electrical substations in central North Carolina were knocked out by gunfire, there are still more questions than answers about the incident. The outage left about 45,000 customers without power, some for as long as five days
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Charlotte plans electric vehicle sharing service at affordable housing ...
Preview: Think of it as Zipcar for electric vehicles in underserved neighborhoods: In some Charlotte affordable housing complexes next year you'll be able to reserve and drive EVs as part of a federally backed car-sharing pilot program.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Groups say Duke Energy carbon plan limits their climate efforts ...
Preview: Businesses and local governments across North Carolina have set goals for reducing their reliance on fossil fuels. But they say those climate goals could be out of reach unless state regulators require changes in Duke Energy's plan for cutting carbon emissions from energy generation.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Regulators get few answers from Duke about substation attacks ...
Preview: Duke Energy officials faced questions from state utility regulators in Raleigh on Monday about the Dec. 3 attack on two electrical substations in Moore County. Three Duke executives offered few new details and still aren't saying publicly what the attack might cost customers.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Gaston mine would supply needed lithium, but neighbors fight it ...
Preview: There's a race on to mine lithium in the U.S. for electric vehicle batteries. It's part of the fight to slow global warming — and to some people a matter of national security. But to neighbors, a proposed mine in Gaston County is an impending environmental disaster.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: A proposed lithium mine presents a climate versus environment ...
Preview: The U.S. wants to mine lithium for electric vehicle batteries to meet climate change goals. But residents near a proposed open-pit mine object.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Appeals court upholds dismissal of suit over Confederate plates ...
Preview: A federal appeals court has upheld the dismissal of a lawsuit over North Carolina's decision to stop issuing specialty license plates with the Confederate battle flag.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Will NC join California in cutting payments to rooftop solar owners ...
Preview: California utility regulators last week adopted new rules sought by utility companies that reduce what rooftop solar owners get paid for electricity they send back to the grid. Will North Carolina be next?
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Climate activists chain themselves to entries at Charlotte private jet ...
Preview: Several climate protesters chained themselves to a door and a gate Thursday morning at the private jet terminal at Charlotte Douglas International Airport.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Expert witness hearing starts Tuesday on Duke Energy's carbon ...
Preview: Since filing its plans, Duke has faced a barrage of criticism from local government leaders, businesses, environmental groups and the attorney general's office.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Amid climate change, Duke Energy spends millions on the power ...
Preview: Climate change is already quietly costing us millions of dollars, as we try to prepare for extreme weather. In the Columbus County seat of Whiteville on Monday, Duke Energy celebrated the opening of a new electrical substation, part of $30 million in upgrades by Duke to ensure the power grid can withstand the next big hurricane.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Buyers plan apartments, shops at two former Duke Energy buildings ...
Preview: Duke Energy completed the sale of two properties in uptown Charlotte last week as it prepares to consolidate office space at its new headquarters tower on South Tryon Street. Redevelopment plans for the two buildings include apartments, shops and offices.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy and its critics battle over its 'clean energy transition ...
Preview: Federal and state officials are pushing electricity producers to shift away from fossil fuels to fight climate change. Here in North Carolina, state regulators are drafting a plan this fall to do that. Duke Energy is promoting its vision for a gradual "clean energy transition." At the same time, business and environmental groups are calling for a faster and cheaper shift.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Encore: Some residents are concerned about domestic lithium ...
Preview: The U.S. wants to mine more domestic lithium for electric vehicle batteries. It would require demolishing houses, digging up farms and disrupting streams. Some residents worry about the impact.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Home buyers should be told about past flood damage, groups say ...
Preview: Home sellers in North Carolina have to tell buyers if their properties are in a flood zone, but they don't have to say if homes have been damaged by flooding. As climate change brings more intense storms, environmental groups want to change that.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Changing Climate in the Carolinas | WFAE 90.7 - Charlotte's NPR ...
Preview: WFAE climate reporter David Boraks looks at how climate change is affecting us in the Carolinas, and how we're responding.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: As the climate warms, we can't overlook threat of nighttime heat ...
Preview: Climate change has increased the number of hot days nationwide and increased the likelihood of unhealthy extreme heat. As we look for ways to cope, we usually focus on daytime heat. But researchers at Duke University say not enough attention is paid to higher temperatures overnight.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC governor's order calls for a faster shift to electric trucks and ...
Preview: Gov. Roy Cooper issued another climate-related executive order Tuesday, this time pushing to increase the sale of electric trucks and buses in North Carolina. The governor said it would help the state meet its climate goals and create jobs.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: AG Josh Stein says regulators should not adopt Duke Energy's ...
Preview: NC Attorney General Josh Stein says state regulators should reject Duke Energy's proposals for reducing carbon from energy generation and instead, adopt a plan that meets the state's clean energy goals and costs less.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC experts don't see much progress at U.N. climate talks | WFAE ...
Preview: The United Nations climate summit in Egypt closed last weekend with an agreement to create a fund for developing nations dealing with the effects of climate change caused mainly by carbon emissions in rich nations. But there was no movement on efforts to cut heat-trapping pollution that causes global warming — and North Carolina climate experts said this week there's lots more to be done.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Instant study links Hurricane Ian's heavier rains to climate change ...
Preview: As Hurricane Ian barrels through the Carolinas, it's a safe bet that climate change has something to do with its intensity.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Officials tour Gastonia flood project, announce federal grants | WFAE ...
Preview: Federal officials and Gov. Roy Cooper toured a federally-funded flood control project in Gastonia Friday to promote two programs that help communities nationwide deal with the effects of climate change.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy wants to pilot using F-150 batteries to supply the grid ...
Preview: Duke Energy has asked state regulators to approve a test that would allow the utility to draw energy from electric vehicle batteries to the power grid during times of peak demand.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy seeks a 16% rate hike for eastern NC and Asheville ...
Preview: Duke Energy has asked North Carolina regulators to approve rate increases totaling 16% over three years for customers of its Duke Energy Progress unit, in eastern North Carolina and the Asheville area. Duke says the extra money would pay to strengthen the electric grid, improve reliability and prepare for more renewable energy.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy names Bowman to replace De May as North Carolina ...
Preview: Duke Energy has named Kendal Bowman as president of its North Carolina operations. Bowman takes over on Jan. 1 from state President Stephen De May, who is retiring after 33 years.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Repairs complete on Moore County substations, power restored ...
Preview: Duke Energy on Wednesday finished repairing and testing two electrical substations in Moore County that were damaged by gunfire Saturday. The attacks cut power to about 45,000 customers initially.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Moore County attack spurs U.S. regulators to order study of electric ...
Preview: Federal energy regulators on Thursday ordered a study to determine if security standards need to be improved following recent attacks on electrical facilities, including one in North Carolina.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: EPA funds air quality studies in underserved communities | WFAE ...
Preview: The EPA has awarded $53 million in grants for air quality testing in communities around the country, including three in North Carolina. The money will go to areas where pollution and the COVID-19 pandemic have led to environmental and health disparities.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: With funds left over, Duke Energy adds 1 more round of solar ...
Preview: Duke Energy's five-year rooftop solar rebate program in North Carolina was supposed to end in July. But the utility says it will add one final application period in January.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Vote could affect climate policy, but it's mostly not being discussed ...
Preview: Next month's midterm elections could hinder national and local efforts to pass or even keep laws addressing climate change, according to experts from Duke University. But climate change is mostly absent from the discussion on the campaign trail.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC environmental justice board to discuss wood pellet industry ...
Preview: North Carolina's environmental justice advisory board has called a special meeting in Raleigh Thursday night to discuss concerns about the fast-growing wood pellet industry.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Has the house you're buying ever flooded? Undisclosed risk may ...
Preview: In North Carolina and many other states, sellers don't have to tell home buyers if a house has ever been damaged by flooding. A new study says that lack of disclosure can mean unexpected and costly future damages.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Gov. Cooper says Moore County attack signals a 'new threat level ...
Preview: North Carolina Gov. Roy Cooper says he wants utilities to ramp up electric grid security following Saturday’s gunfire attack on two electrical substations in Moore County that knocked out power to about 45,000 customers.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Pellet plant permit delayed amid environmental justice concerns ...
Preview: State officials have delayed approving an expansion for a wood pellet plant in northeastern North Carolina while they consider concerns about how the plant affects the environment and nearby communities of color.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Environmental justice board hears concerns about wood pellet ...
Preview: The state's growing wood pellet industry came under fire at a meeting in Raleigh last night from scientists, activists and residents who live near wood pellet plants.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Scientists oppose Duke Energy plans for more gas-fired plants ...
Preview: A group of 45 scientists, including some who formerly worked for the EPA, is urging North Carolina officials not to approve Duke Energy's plan to build more gas-fired power plants. Duke wants to expand its use of natural gas as part of a plan to reduce and eventually eliminate carbon emissions by 2050.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Shots fired near Duke Energy hydroelectric dam in South Carolina ...
Preview: Someone fired shots near a Duke Energy hydroelectric dam in South Carolina on Wednesday afternoon, but nobody was hurt and there were no damages.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Coastal scientist says storm damage is an opportunity to rethink how ...
Preview: Federal officials have pledged financial support for rebuilding as the Southeast recovers from Hurricane Ian. But the storm's havoc has rekindled the debate over how we rebuild in coastal areas.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy and its critics battle over its 'clean energy transition ...

Here in North Carolina, state regulators are drafting a plan this fall to do that. Duke Energy is promoting its vision for a gradual "clean energy transition." At the same time, business and environmental groups are calling for a faster and cheaper shift.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Preview: Rooftop solar power has become something of a frontier land rush as we shift to renewable energy to fight climate change. Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Rising natural gas prices push up Duke Energy electric rates in NC ...
Preview: Higher fuel costs and new renewable energy programs are pushing up rates for Duke Energy customers in most of western and central North Carolina.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: N.C. lithium suppliers say climate law will help their businesses ...
Preview: The federal climate and health care law enacted last week has provisions aimed at boosting the U.S. electric vehicle industry. North Carolina lithium mining companies say it will help their business of supplying electric vehicle makers.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Albemarle plans $200M lithium research center in Charlotte | WFAE ...
Preview: Charlotte-based chemicals supplier Albemarle Corp. plans a $200 million lithium research center in Charlotte's University Research Park. The company says the center will create 200 jobs and support the fast-growing market for lithium and electric vehicle batteries.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke says clean energy plan will help climate goals, raise rates ...
Preview: Duke Energy told investors Tuesday it will boost spending on clean energy to $145 billion over the next 10 years, which it says will increase profits and meet a new goal for cutting the heat-trapping pollution that causes global warming. But Duke also says it will mean higher rates.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NOAA says sunny-day flooding accelerates with sea level rise ...
Preview: Federal scientists say high-tide flooding is becoming more common on the East and Gulf coasts and the risk is accelerating as the ocean rises due to climate change.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: At Camp Lejeune, the Marines plan a microgrid for storm resilience ...
Preview: The U.S. Marine Corps plans a $22 million dollar electricity microgrid at Camp Lejeune, to keep a key section of the base running during major outages.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy seeks a 16% rate hike for eastern NC and Asheville ...
Preview: Duke Energy has asked North Carolina regulators to approve rate increases totaling 16% over three years for customers of its Duke Energy Progress unit, in eastern North Carolina and the Asheville area. Duke says the extra money would pay to strengthen the electric grid, improve reliability and prepare for more renewable energy.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Korean company invests $100M in Huntersville EV charging startup ...
Preview: A Korean energy company has invested $100 million in a Huntersville-based startup named Atom Power that makes electric vehicle charging equipment.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: City faces a decision as costs for its planned solar farm rise 25 ...
Preview: Rising equipment costs at a proposed solar farm in Iredell County are threatening the city of Charlotte's goal to switch city buildings to 100% carbon-free electricity by 2030.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Mecklenburg County begins public meetings as it drafts ...
Preview: Mecklenburg County is working with a consultant to develop an Environmental Justice Action Plan. The idea is to identify and work to end disparities in water and air pollution, food and housing. County officials are seeking public feedback at a series of public meetings this month and next.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: AG Josh Stein says regulators should not adopt Duke Energy's ...
Preview: NC Attorney General Josh Stein says state regulators should reject Duke Energy's proposals for reducing carbon from energy generation and instead, adopt a plan that meets the state's clean energy goals and costs less.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Sprite's switch from green to clear plastic is welcomed, but is it ...
Preview: Coca-Cola Co.'s recent announcement that it will start producing the soft drink Sprite in clear instead of green bottles will make recycling easier. But climate groups say it's not enough.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC governor's order calls for a faster shift to electric trucks and ...
Preview: Gov. Roy Cooper issued another climate-related executive order Tuesday, this time pushing to increase the sale of electric trucks and buses in North Carolina. The governor said it would help the state meet its climate goals and create jobs.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Gas line work in Lincoln County could include noise and flames ...
Preview: Piedmont Natural Gas will begin routine maintenance Monday on a natural gas line off N.C. 150 east of Lincolnton and doesn't want it to be a surprise to people in the area.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Preview: The U.S. wants to mine lithium for electric vehicle batteries to meet climate change goals. But residents near a proposed open-pit mine object.

Article.Title: With funds left over, Duke Energy adds 1 more round of solar ...
Preview: Duke Energy's five-year rooftop solar rebate program in North Carolina was supposed to end in July. But the utility says it will add one final application period in January.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy considers selling its commercial renewables business ...
Preview: Duke Energy says it's considering the sale of its commercial renewable energy business, to focus future investments on its consumer utilities. The Charlotte-based company announced a "strategic review" of the business as part of its quarterly profit report this morning.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Coalition seeks federal funding for a Southeast hydrogen hub ...
Preview: Utilities and other companies around the Southeast have banded together to seek federal funding to develop a regional center for producing clean hydrogen. The goal is to replace fossil fuels at power and industrial plants.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: As the planet warms, fall colors come later and may be duller ...
Preview: The fall foliage is hitting peak colors this week in the North Carolina mountains. The rest of the state will follow over the next couple of weeks. Experts say it appears to be a good year, with intense colors coming at what used to be a normal time — mid-October. But that's been slipping later because of global warming.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Pipeline builder halts legal effort to acquire land for NC extension ...
Preview: Developers of a proposed pipeline extension that would bring natural gas to North Carolina have withdrawn legal proceedings to acquire land for the project. But the Mountain Valley Pipeline said it's not abandoning the $468 million project.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: These climate scientists feel 'a higher calling' — civil disobedience
Preview: On Thursday, four people, including two climate scientists, were charged with trespassing after they chained themselves to entryways at Charlotte Douglas International Airport's private jet terminal.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy considers selling its commercial renewables business ...
Preview: Duke Energy says it's considering the sale of its commercial renewable energy business, to focus future investments on its consumer utilities. The Charlotte-based company announced a "strategic review" of the business as part of its quarterly profit report this morning.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy hopes renewable biz sale makes stock more attractive ...
Preview: Duke Energy says it will go ahead with the sale of its commercial renewable energy business, after studying the idea since August. The Charlotte-based company thinks the spinoff will make its remaining regulated businesses more attractive to investors.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Thousands get power back, but many more will be in the dark for ...
Preview: Duke Energy says about 7,000 customers in Moore County got power back overnight after someone shot critical equipment at two substations over the weekend. But Duke spokesman Jeff Brooks said 38,000 customers were still without power Monday morning.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC pellet plant wants to expand, but some worry about emissions ...
Preview: The world's largest producer of wood pellets wants to expand production at a plant in eastern North Carolina — and to emit more greenhouse gases.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Environmental justice board hears concerns about wood pellet ...
Preview: The state's growing wood pellet industry came under fire at a meeting in Raleigh last night from scientists, activists and residents who live near wood pellet plants.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Battery component maker plans $3.5B campus near Charleston ...
Preview: Redwood Materials, a Nevada company that makes electric vehicle battery components, says it will build a $3.5 billion campus near Charleston, South Carolina. State officials say it's the largest economic development investment in South Carolina's history.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy wants to pilot using F-150 batteries to supply the grid ...
Preview: Duke Energy has asked state regulators to approve a test that would allow the utility to draw energy from electric vehicle batteries to the power grid during times of peak demand.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: EPA funds air quality studies in underserved communities | WUNC
Preview: The EPA has awarded $53 million in grants for air quality testing in communities around the country, including three in North Carolina. The money will go to areas where pollution and the COVID-19 pandemic have led to environmental and health disparities.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Rising cost to update Mecklenburg recycling center means higher ...
Preview: Costs for a planned upgrade of Mecklenburg County's north Charlotte recycling center have more than doubled over the past year. And that could mean higher than expected increases in trash hauling fees for the next four years.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: North Carolina doesn't pick electric mix to lower carbon levels ...
Preview: North Carolina utility regulators have told Duke Energy to carry out a series of activities to generate electricity that they say will help ensure greenhouse gas reductions set in a new state law are met. But the Utilities Commission's directives announced late Friday on solar, wind, nuclear and other sources for electricity don't endorse any particular mix of energy sources to meet the mandates.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC lawmakers want to study benefits, savings from overhauling ...
Preview: A bill filed at the North Carolina House of Representatives on Tuesday would pay for a study of electricity market reforms that backers say would reduce energy bills and prevent blackouts like those that struck Duke Energy customers last December.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: SC eyes electricity market changes that could save customers ...
Preview: A report on possible changes in the structure of South Carolina's electricity market is getting attention here, north of the border, because any changes there could have a big impact.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: David Boraks selected for NPR Climate Summit | WFAE 90.7 ...
Preview: WFAE climate reporter David Boraks will take part in NPR’s first climate summit in June in Washington, D.C.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: North Carolina hopes to adopt electric truck rules by year's end ...
Preview: The rules would apply to any truck over 6,001 pounds — basically, pickups up to tractor-trailers. Sales targets would vary by size, between seven classes, with the goal of eventually 40%-75% of trucks sold in the state being zero-emission vehicles.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Q&A: NC regulators back Duke's 'all of the above' carbon plan ...
Preview: North Carolina's 2021 energy reform law called on state regulators to adopt a plan to cut carbon emissions from power plants to fight climate change. Last Friday, after months of filings and hearings, the North Carolina Utilities Commission issued a 137-page order. It largely accepted the recommendations of Duke Energy, the state's main power producer. WFAE climate reporter David Boraks talks with host Marshall Terry about what it means, for both the state's climate goals and customers.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Charlotte city council agrees to 25% price hike for solar farm | WFAE ...
Preview: The Charlotte City Council voted Monday in favor of amending the city's contract to buy electricity from a planned solar farm in Iredell County and absorb a 25% fee increase. The council also approved an economic development grant for a new lithium research center in northeast Charlotte.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Speakers raise concerns about state's shift to electric trucks | WFAE ...
Preview: People who operate truck fleets will be on the front lines if North Carolina adopts rules this year to get more electric trucks and buses on state roads. In Charlotte Friday, state environmental officials heard some of their concerns about cost, evolving technology, and charging.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Advocates worry Duke Energy's newly approved plan to cut solar ...
Preview: Rules will change this summer for Duke Energy customers who install rooftop solar panels in North Carolina. Some industry experts worry new lower payments and a more complicated system could slow solar's growth.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Removing a century-old dam would restore species and reconnect ...
Preview: For nearly a century, the Ela Dam in the North Carolina mountains has provided electricity but also altered wildlife habitats and disconnected the community. Land conservation and environmental groups have joined the Eastern Band of Cherokee Indians in an ambitious plan to remove the aging dam. But that hinges on getting millions of dollars in federal funding.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Earth kept warming last year, continuing a 40-year trend | WUNC
Preview: Federal climate scientists say the global average temperature last year was the sixth highest on record. The past nine years have been the warmest since 1880 and the long-term trend tells the same story.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: What we can learn from cooling past about heat-inspired climate ...
Preview: A UNC Greensboro professor says new research on big climate disruptions from the past can help us understand how global warming could affect society in the future.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy seeks big rate increase in central and western NC to ...
Preview: Duke Energy has asked state regulators for a nearly 17% rate increase in western and central North Carolina to cover rising costs for natural gas and coal over the past year. That's the largest increase for fuel costs in the company's history and means Duke has pending rate hikes before regulators that total 27%.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Federal grant funds restoration projects in NC wildlife refuges ...
Preview: A $27.5 million federal grant is coming to eastern North Carolina to restore the Albemarle and Pamlico sounds. The U.S. Department of the Interior says the money comes from last year's Inflation Reduction Act. It's part of $120 million in grants to help national and state wildlife refuges restore waterways and repair damage from severe weather made worse by climate change.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Charlotte council votes to slow purchases of electric buses; what ...
Preview: The Charlotte Area Transit System is tapping the brakes on plans to convert to 100% electric buses by 2030. And the slowdown is raising concerns among council members and environmentalists that Charlotte might not be able to meet the city's climate goals.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Cold-weather blackouts challenge conventional wisdom on ...
Preview: One of the longstanding arguments against renewable energy like wind and solar is that it's not as reliable as conventional power plants. But the Christmas Eve rolling blackouts in North Carolina turned that conventional wisdom on its head.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Elder-led protesters want banks to stop financing fossil fuels | WFAE ...
Preview: A climate protest in uptown Charlotte at midday Tuesday called on Bank of America, Wells Fargo and other large banks to stop financing fossil fuel-related businesses.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke wins approval to test using EV batteries to power the grid ...
Preview: North Carolina regulators have approved a pilot program that would allow Duke Energy to supplement the power grid with electricity from customers' electric vehicle batteries when demand is high. The test will initially involve 100 customers who lease Ford F-150 Lightning pickup trucks.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Gaston County lithium mine gets another extension for state permit ...
Preview: North Carolina mining regulators have granted another extension of Piedmont Lithium's deadline to provide information about its application to build a lithium mine in northern Gaston County.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: 'We own what happened': Duke Energy officials say forecasting ...
Preview: Duke Energy officials told state regulators Tuesday that their computer models underestimated power demand by 6% to 10% during frigid weather on Christmas Eve. That and a shortage of electricity from power plants, contributed to the need for rolling blackouts across North Carolina at a time when temperatures dipped into the single digits.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NCDEQ wants to adopt electric truck and bus rules by year's end ...
Preview: North Carolina environmental officials are facing lots of questions as they push to adopt rules by year's end that would speed sales of electric trucks and buses.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: NC study maps out shift to electric cars, appliances, factories | WFAE ...
Preview: North Carolina will need more electric vehicles on the road, cleaner energy sources and a faster shift away from fossil fuels in all parts of the economy to meet its climate goals, according to a new report from Gov. Roy Cooper's office.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Piedmont Lithium's deal with Tesla is still on — with revisions | WUNC
Preview: Piedmont Lithium says it has amended a previously announced contract with electric vehicle maker Tesla to supply lithium beginning later this year.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy wants to raise rates 16% for central and western NC ...
Preview: Duke Energy is asking state regulators for a 15.7% rate increase over three years for central and western North Carolina, including Charlotte. Increases for residential customers would grow slightly faster than that.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Charlotte just had its first snow-less winter, as average temps rise ...
Preview: Charlotte hit a climate milestone with the start of spring Monday: For the first time since record-keeping began, not even a trace of snow fell on the city this winter.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Regulators urged to tighten permit for Huntersville pipeline cleanup ...
Preview: Residents, public officials and environmental groups urged state regulators in Huntersville Thursday night to tighten requirements for a water-quality permit that Colonial Pipeline needs to speed cleanup of a massive gasoline spill two and a half years ago.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy starts work on a Carbon Plan 2.0 in North Carolina ...
Preview: Just two months after North Carolina regulators signed off on Duke Energy's long-range plan for reducing carbon emissions, the company on Wednesday kicked off planning for a new version.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Southeast overlooks energy efficiency as a climate tool, report finds ...
Preview: As North Carolina addresses the causes of climate change, much of the focus has been on switching from fossil-fuel power plants to renewable energy, such as wind and solar. We hear less about another important tactic — energy efficiency.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: State wants to improve energy efficiency, but builders object | WFAE ...
Preview: The North Carolina Building Code Council is considering tightening energy efficiency requirements for new homes and offices that could cut energy costs and help slow climate change. But at a public hearing Tuesday, home builders fought the idea.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Work group puzzles over how to deal with NC beach houses at risk ...
Preview: Coastal experts say North Carolina lacks the money and laws it needs to deal with hundreds of beachfront houses at risk of collapsing into the Atlantic Ocean because of sea level rise and erosion. A new state task force is looking for solutions.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Two new EV battery-related plants are coming to South Carolina ...
Preview: Two new factories announced Wednesday in South Carolina will continue the expansion of electric vehicle supply chain businesses in the Carolinas.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Appeals court says Outer Banks bridge project can proceed | WFAE ...
Preview: A federal appeals court has ruled that the state can proceed with a $500 million bridge between the mainland and North Carolina's Outer Banks, despite the objections of environmental and citizens' groups.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Plan aims to cut emissions, even as North Carolinians drive more ...
Preview: North Carolina transportation officials have sent the governor a Clean Transportation Plan for cutting carbon emissions from transportation to meet the state's climate goals.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Duke Energy reports a loss, announces $300M in cost cuts ...
Preview: Duke Energy reported a $531 million loss for the fourth quarter as it wrote down the value of its commercial renewable energy business that's up for sale. The Charlotte-based company also announced plans to cut $300 million in expenses this year, including through layoffs mainly in Charlotte.
Key.Author: David Boraks

Article.Title: Second NC wind farm could start construction this summer; plus ...
Preview: The project's developer, Apex Clean Energy, says the turbines will be one-quarter to one-half mile apart on managed timberland and farmland. Their capacity to generate 189 megawatts of electricity will be enough to power 47,000 homes, according to Apex.

Preview: High in the Savannah sky, volunteers watch over bird nests and build community through a remote network of Cornell University wildlife cameras.

Preview: Climate Action Campaign hosted a celebration for Savannah leaders lauding federal funding for local clean energy expansion on the coast.

Article.Title: Georgia Senate bill proposes a ban on plastic bags at points of sale
Preview: The Georgia senate is considering a plastic bag ban. They haven't been popular in the past, but the bill hopes to clean up pollution starting in 2026.

Preview: While new regulations might increase oversight into the content and distribution of soil amendment, some worry about issues of enforcement.

Article.Title: Oversight of soil amendments needed at county level in Georgia
Preview: County-level officials and advocates in Georgia say the state needs to allow more oversight and enforcement of soil amendments at the local level.

Article.Title: Peeing and public urination during Savannah St. Patrick's Day Parade
Preview: St. Patrick's Day is a day unlike any other in Savannah, but you still can't pee in public. Here's what to know about St. Patty's potty options.

Article.Title: Retired EPD agent says more regulation needed for soil amendments
Preview: The business model for producing and distributing soil amendments takes advantage of loose industry regulation, says one-time EPD agent.

Preview: Seeking a cheap alternative to fertilizer, Georgia farmer Paul Urbanek came to regret his encounter with someone spreading "free" soil amendment.
Key.Author: Marisa Mecke

Article.Title: Soil amendment brought flies, buzzards, smell to Georgia horse trainer
Preview: The stench and content of soil amendments spread next door greatly impacted this Georgia horse trainer's professional and personal lives.

Article.Title: Can Atlanta catch a climate funding windfall?
Preview: Chandra Farley, an energy consultant with deep roots in advocacy, is Atlanta Mayor Andre Dickens' choice to be the city's sustainability chief. Farley, who started Thursday, is the office’s first permanent director in almost a year.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Summer nights in the South are getting hotter, quicker, increasing ...
Preview: In July 2022, Atlanta’s average minimum temperature, or overnight low, was a torrid 73.5 degrees, a full 4.6 degrees warmer than the 20th century average. Nighttime temperatures have risen faster than daytime temperatures across the Southeast during the region’s warmest decade on record.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Atlanta Creek League raises awareness of river tributaries
Preview: The recently-launched Atlanta Creek League invites people to join their local creek “team,” each belonging to one of the three river “divisions.” Teams compete for points by completing individual or group activities ranging from “take a nap by your creek” to reporting illegal dumping.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Georgia PSC commissioner sued over social media blocks
Preview: A candidate who sought to unseat Georgia Public Service Commission Vice Chairman Tim Echols has filed a federal lawsuit alleging Echols blocked her and others from his social media accounts over criticism of his performance.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Atlanta air quality improved, but still gets an F in annual survey
Preview: Metro Atlanta’s air quality has improved significantly over the past two decades, but the area still received a failing grade this year from the American Lung Association for harmful smog.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: As heat waves grow more frequent, researchers hunt for Atlanta's ...
Preview: Climate scientists say extreme heat events, like the one Atlanta experienced this week, bear the fingerprints of human-caused climate change. And as the city warms, a new initiative is aiming to capture a fuller picture of the heat risk faced in different neighborhoods.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Profits, EV charging dominate latest round of Georgia Power hearings
Preview: Georgia Power and Public Service Commission members and staff clashed over how much profit the state’s largest utility will be able to make in the years ahead as state regulators resumed hearings Tuesday on proposed rate hikes that could affect 2.7 million Georgia Power customers.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Residents to get hearing in discrimination claim against Georgia EPD
Preview: Judge Shakara Barnes last week partially denied a state agency's motion to dismiss acomplaint over its decision to allow Spectrum Energy Georgia to build a new pellet processing facility in Adel.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Georgia coastal wetlands need room to move, report says
Preview: Georgia’s coastal wetlands are under threat from rising seas, and how the state and local communities respond could spell the difference between a net gain or a net loss of these vital ecosystems, a new study says.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Facebook parent Meta to double solar capacity in Georgia
Preview: Meta, the parent company of Facebook and Instagram, announced plans Thursday to build seven new solar projects in Georgia and Tennessee.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Bald eagles set Georgia nesting record, but disease threatens ...
Preview: Georgia wildlife officials counted a record number of bald eagle nests in the state this year, despite an outbreak of bird flu among the raptors on the coast that depressed successful hatching there.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Georgia clean water advocates highlight progress, call for more action
Preview: The Georgia Water Coalition’s annual “Dirty Dozen” report traditionally shines a light on what the group considers to be the worst offenses against Georgia waters. This year, the organization instead highlighted the landmark legal cases that resulted in significant improvements to the state’s waterways while calling attention to ongoing issues.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: New rules could bar public from Ga. regulator's rate hike talks
Preview: New rules could bar public from Ga. Public Service Commission's rate hike talks. Transparency advocates concerned PSC’s directive could violate Georgia's Open Meetings Act.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Proposed Georgia wood pellet mill at center of environmental fight
Preview: Activists and a group of South Georgia residents are calling for the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency to adopt stricter oversight of wood pellet mills popping up across the region to feed global demand for biomass energy.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Metro Atlanta to see more 'dangerous days' of high heat by 2053 ...
Preview: Longer heat waves and a doubling of dangerously hot days will bake metro Atlanta over the next three decades, according to report .
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Atlanta meets EPA standards for air quality, but just barely
Preview: Metro Atlanta’s improved smog levels allowed the area to meet federal standards for ozone pollution by the a critical 2021 deadline — but just barely, state and federal data show.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Mableton school tackles climate education with reflective playground
Preview: The basketball court and playground of SAE School in Mableton were painted in a reflective coating designed to reduce heat.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Hot weather puts Georgia outdoor workers at risk
Preview: As Georgia's temperatures continue to rise, outdoor workers on farms and construction sites increasingly are exposed to heat-related health risks. But there are currently no requirements for water or shade breaks, among other protective measures.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Climate change remains partisan issue in Georgia elections
Preview: The next governor of Georgia and the winner of the state’s high-profile U.S. Senate race will face consequential decisions in the years to come over climate change. But the debate over how to respond to warming temperatures, stronger storms and rising sea levels is one of contrasts.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Monarch counts may not be as dire, but researchers are divided
Preview: Scientists say monarch butterflies are threatened by climate change, herbicide use and habitat destruction, but a new study by researchers, including two from the University of Georgia, suggests monarch butterflies may not be as threatened as previously thought.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Sorting behind the scenes: What fans don't see at 'zero waste' venues

Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Big business wants solar energy. Can Georgia utilities keep up?
Preview: Large corporations, led by big tech, are driving much of the solar power development in Georgia and across the country — and challenging utilities to keep up.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Georgia officials announce bipartisan hydrogen energy 'braintrust'
Preview: Jon Ossoff, Georgia’s Democratic U.S. senator, and Tim Echols, the Republican vice chair of the state’s utilities regulator, have teamed up to create a coalition of experts and business leaders to promote Georgia as a center for hydrogen energy.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Atlanta eyes subsidizing e-bikes as popularity surges
Preview: Atlanta City Council is weighing a proposal to follow in the footsteps of places like Denver, Boston and Rhode Island by offering city residents rebates for e-bikes.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: In Sterigenics lawsuit against Cobb County, judge issues mixed ruling

Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Georgia bill would make attacking critical infrastructure a felony
Preview: Following a string of high-profile attacks around the nation, a group of Georgia lawmakers are seeking to increase penalties for anyone intentionally damaging critical infrastructure, including power, water and telecommunications equipment.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Bill to protect gas leaf blowers from local bans passes Georgia Senate
Preview: A bill that would prevent Georgia cities and counties from banning gas-powered leaf blowers passed the state Senate Monday with bipartisan support after the proposal was amended to include a sunset clause.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Virtual town halls on Okefenokee titanium mine set for Tuesday and ...
Preview: The Georgia Environmental Protection Division is scheduled to hold two virtual public comment sessions this week on a draft plan submitted by Alabama-based Twin Pines Minerals to mine for titanium next to the Okefenokee National Wildlife Refuge in South Georgia.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Why buildings are at the center of Atlanta's fight vs. climate change
Preview: Office towers. Malls. City buildings. Hotels. Apartments. Houses. Each consumes energy. Many do so inefficiently. Natural gas and electricity consumption by buildings are Atlanta’s two largest sources of greenhouse gas emissions, the city says.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: PSC commissioner agrees to unblock social media critics after suit
Preview: Georgia Public Service Commission (PSC) Vice Chairman Tim Echols has agreed not to block social media accounts or delete online comments critical of his performance as a utility regulator — a first step toward resolving a federal lawsuit filed last year, according to the plaintiff’s attorney.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Georgia bill seeks to protect gas-powered leaf blowers from local bans
Preview: Georgia Senate Republicans are resuming efforts to pass a law that would bar local governments from limiting the use of gas-powered leaf blowers, even as such efforts appear to have fizzled at the local level.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Opponents turn out in force for Georgia EPD hearings on proposed ...
Preview: Residents and environmental groups spoke overwhelmingly in opposition this week during a pair of hearings on a controversial mine proposed next to the Okefenokee Swamp in South Georgia.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz

Article.Title: Advocates file civil rights complaint against Georgia EPD
Preview: When issuing air quality permits for industrial facilities, Georgia environmental regulators must consider the race and ethnicity of surrounding communities, an advocacy group argues in a complaint filed this week with the federal government.
Key.Author: Meris Lutz
